es.upm.dit.gsi.gsilejos.lejos.robotics.navigation

Class DifferentialPilot

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.upm.dit.gsi.gsilejos.lejos.robotics.navigation.DifferentialPilot

  • public class DifferentialPilot
extends Object
    Class to simulate the Lejos DifferentialPilot Be careful, some methods are unimplemented
    Author:
    amardomingo

    • Method Detail

      • setSimbad

        public void setSimbad(int x,
             int z,
             int waitTime,
             UltrasonicSensor sensorL,
             UltrasonicSensor sensorR,
             UltrasonicSensor sensorF,
             boolean realism,
             int maze)
        Method to configure and start simbad.
        Parameters:
        x,y - 'int' Starting position for the robot
        waitTime - 'int' time to wait between sensor measurements
        sensor - the 'UltrasonicSensor' used by the pilot
        realism - if true, add random deviations to the movements
        maze - The maze number (from 0 to 5)

      • calibrarSimbad

        public void calibrarSimbad()
        Simbad Self-calibration. Sets the wait time according to its own testing

      • calibrarSimbad

        public void calibrarSimbad(int toWaitTime)
        Calibrate simbad to the given waitTime
        Parameters:
        toWaitTime - the time between sensors meassurements

        public float getTravelSpeed()
        Getter. Returns the pilot travel speed
        Returns:

      • forward

        public void forward()
        Sets the pilot translational speed

      • backward

        public void backward()
        Sets the pilot transaltional speed, reverse. Inverse operation than 'forward'

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double angle)
        Rotate the motor the given angle
        Parameters:
        angle - - The angle to rotate, in degrees

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double angle,
          boolean immediateReturn)
        Runs 'rotate' in a new Thread if immediateReturn is true
        Parameters:
        angle -
        immediateReturn - if true, launch a new thread

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft()
        Rotates 90º to the left

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight()
        Rotates 90º to the right

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the robot, setting both Translational and Rotational Speeds to 0

      • quickStop

        public void quickStop()
        Stops the robot, setting both Translational and Rotational Speeds to 0 For the simulator, this is equals to call stop()

      • isMoving

        public boolean isMoving()
        Returns true if any of the speeds is true
        Returns:
        true if the pilot is on the move
